intro: Ptilotus drummondii var. drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, bristly appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that appear in dense clusters, often during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological resilience make it a notable species in its native habitat.
